alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 17 at 4:25AM EST until February 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Rain changing to heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches, sleet accumulations of around one half of an inch and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Aroostook County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Power outages are possible.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
